snippet: Leigh Castergine, a former senior vice president for ticket sales, and the Mets resolved the case on Friday, with no terms disclosed.
abstract: New York Mets resolve lawsuit with Leigh Castergine, former senior vice president for ticket sales, with no terms discussed; Castergine alleged she was fired because she complained about discriminatory treatment over her pregnancy to team's human resources department.
lead_paragraph: Leigh Castergine, a former senior vice president for ticket sales, and the Mets resolved the case on Friday, with no terms disclosed.

headline.main: Mets Resolve Suit With Executive They Fired When She Was Pregnant and Unmarried
headline.print_headline: Mets Resolve Suit With Executive They Fired When She Was Pregnant and Unmarried
